newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: WTO states agree to consider Azerbaijan entry.
newsitem.headline: WTO states agree to consider Azerbaijan entry.

text.p: Member states of the World Trade Organisation (WTO) agreed on Wednesday to begin negotiations with the former communist state of Azerbaijan on its request for membership.
Azerbaijan will join 12 other ex-Soviet republics -- including Russia, Ukraine and Kazakhstan -- whose applications are being considered.
Russia has now been negotiating entry with the WTO's currently 131 full members for over four years, and trade diplomats say the process is likely to drag on for at least another year.
Azerbaijan is likely to be admitted in a shorter period, but negotiations are likely to last at least two, and possibly three years, according to the diplomats.
To gain admission, a country has to demonstrate that it can bring its practices and regulations in line with the WTO's open trading rules.
